Trial_Design.evidence: This double-blinded randomized-controlled trial included 50 patients undergoing primary THA in 2021–2023.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group received TXA intravenously. The placebo group received 0.9% sodium chloride solution.

Objective.evidence: We hypothesized that no difference exists in the degree of fibrinolysis and blood loss between patients receiving prophylactic TXA and placebo.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome measure was to quantitate the degree of fibrinolysis measured by maximum lysis (ML) demonstrated by ROTEM variables.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This double-blinded randomized-controlled trial included 50 patients undergoing primary THA in 2021–2023.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Blood coagulability tested by ROTEM was within the normal range in all patients, and no difference was found between the TXA group and placebo group.

Harms.evidence: no patient developed fibrinolysis during the entire perioperative phases.
